articles.author: Tom MacWright
articles.description:
The last time I wrote a ‚Äúyear in review‚Äù post was 2017, and before that in 2012. Reading my old writing is nostalgic and horrific.


By the numbers, 2023 was pretty normal: I read around 20 books, ran around 400 miles. It‚Äôs funny how the statistics even out to the same numbers when, during the year, I think I‚Äôm in a reading drought or, like several months this year, hadn‚Äôt run in weeks.
What was the best?

I think that the best book in general that I read was Achieving Our Country by Richard Rorty. I think I‚Äôve been politically shifting for a while now ‚Äì¬†not to the left or the right, but around questions of reform versus radicalism, unification versus schism. Rorty isn‚Äôt the last word on the matter, but reading him was inspiring because it opened my eyes to the other possibilities of how t‚Ä¶
articles.title: Year in Review

articles.author: Tom MacWright
articles.description:
Most people I know fit into one of two camps: they either want to buy a house
and they can‚Äôt, or they‚Äôve bought a house. The desire to own ones own home is
almost universal in the people I know in the US. It‚Äôs even stronger for folks
who live outside of major cities. And people for whom the ‚Äúsecurity‚Äù part of
homeownership rings stronger - who grew up in instability or in countries where
physical goods are preferred to financial instruments for savings.
I don‚Äôt want to buy a house. Maybe I‚Äôll need to, but I can‚Äôt help but think that
the milestone is vastly overrated in public imagination and there are problems
with it on a personal and societal level.
Economics
Houses are non-diversified, illiquid holdings that make up too large a
percentage of people‚Äôs total invested assets.
Your neighbor‚Ä¶
articles.title: Homeownership

sources.title: dotnet Archives - The New Dev's Guide

articles.description: We need to pay more attention to the physical impacts of mental illness. It could not only be messing with your mind, but also your heart, say scientists.
articles.title: Mental illness plays havoc with the mind as well as the heart

articles.description: A new study shows that young adults when sleep-deprived evaluate angry faces as less trustworthy and healthy-looking. Furthermore, neutral and fearful faces appear less attractive following sleep loss.
articles.title: Acute sleep loss may alter the way we see others

articles.description: Scientists pinpoint the molecular epicenter of deep-sleep regulation. The findings, based on research in mice, identify a gene that makes a protein that regulates delta waves -- electrical signals between neurons that occur during the deepest phases of relaxation and are a hallmark of restorative sleep.
articles.title: Molecular basis of deep sleep pinpointed, suggests avenues for novel treatments

articles.description: Researchers presents a new study demonstrating that a small molecule in brain cells affects the level of hypocretin, which is responsible for making us feel awake during the day and tired at night. People with a genetic variation of this molecule have a higher risk of suffering from daytime sleepiness.
articles.title: New sleep molecule discovered: 'It shows just how complex the machinery of sleep is'

articles.description: Seven hours is the ideal amount of sleep for people in their middle age and upwards, with too little or too much little sleep associated with poorer cognitive performance and mental health, say researchers.
articles.title: Seven hours of sleep is optimal in middle and old age, say researchers

articles.description: Up to half of older adults may have sleep apnea, a condition in which breathing and sleep are briefly interrupted many times a night. A new study shows that this chronic tiredness can have serious implications for road safety.
articles.title: Risky driving behaviors increase as common sleep disorder worsens

articles.description: Black women are disproportionately affected by poor sleep, which is associated with increased risk of adverse outcomes such as cardiovascular disease, depression and worse quality of life. The gold standard treatment for insomnia is cognitive behavioral therapy for insomnia (CBT-I), which specifically targets the individual's problematic sleep behaviors and beliefs.
articles.title: Automated cognitive behavioral therapy for insomnia delivered over the internet shown to be highly effective in Black women

articles.description: A new study has paved the way for the first drug treatment for sleep apnea. Compared to before receiving the treatment, breathing pauses decreased with on average more than 20 per hour for patients given the drug.
articles.title: Drug reduced frequency of breathing pauses in sleep apnea

sources.title: Microsoft Tech Community - Latest Blogs - Apps on Azure Blog

articles.author: owaino
articles.description:
Introduction
¬†
Organisations are increasingly understanding the value that machine learning and artificial intelligence can deliver across all industries. Subsequently those organisations are also evaluating how to move machine learning projects from experimental stages to production. This surge in AI/ML interest also comes at a time when businesses are prioritising cost optimization of new and existing technology projects.
¬†
Frequently customers I am speaking too are asking how they can deploy reliable, robust and¬†cost effective deployment platforms for moving machine learning models into production. Customers using Azure to deploy CPU based ML models have a few different options, batch endpoints on Azure Machine Learning, AKS for those familiar with running enterprise Kubernetes and Azur‚Ä¶
articles.title: Deploy Tensorflow Machine Learning models on Azure Container Apps

articles.author: sonjagu
articles.description:
Azure Spring Apps Enterprise plan is now eligible for Azure savings plan for compute!
¬†
All Azure Spring Apps regions under the Enterprise plan are eligible for substantial cost savings ‚Äì 20% for one year and 47% for three years ‚Äì when you commit to Azure savings Plan.
¬†
Committing to the savings plan allows you to get savings, up to the hourly commitment amount, on the resources you use.¬†You can choose to pay all at once or monthly. The best part? Turning on the Savings Plan will not mess with your current set-ups or apps. You just get the savings while everything runs as usual. If you are running big apps, this plan can optimize your investments. It brings down your overall costs for using Azure Spring Apps Enterprise.¬†
¬†

¬†
Here is an example of how Azure savings plan for compute works.‚Ä¶
articles.title: Azure Spring Apps Enterprise is now eligible for Azure savings plan for compute

articles.author: Nikita_Nallamothu
articles.description:
Hello, load testing enthusiasts! Say goodbye to the complexities of JMeter scripting with our new feature which allows you to create load tests directly by providing your HTTP requests. No prior expertise in testing tools is required ‚Äì just navigate to the portal, input your HTTP requests, and you're all set! 
With this new experience you can specify the endpoint, HTTP method, headers, query parameters, or just enter cURL commands effortlessly. But that's not all you also have additional functionalities with this.

Extract data from the response of one request and pass it on to a subsequent request. For example, if you are retrieving an authentication token in a request and would like to use it for authentication in your subsequent requests, you can store it in a variable and do so.
Provid‚Ä¶
articles.title: Create tests by adding HTTP requests in Azure Load Testing

articles.author: kevinguo
articles.description:
This article talks about a popular open-source library called ‚ÄúSocket.IO‚Äù. It‚Äôs often used to build real-time web applications, like multi-player games and co-editing, co-creation applications. 
¬†
¬†It explores the relationship between WebSocket API, Socket.IO library and an Azure service. 

WebSocket API ‚Äì provides the transport-level plumbing of bi-directional communication between clients and server.
Socket.IO library ‚Äì builds on top of WebSocket API and provides application-level features that are common when developing real-time web apps.
Azure Web PubSub for Socket.IO ‚Äì a feature from an Azure service that provides the infrastructure for massive scalability of Socket.IO¬†apps.

¬†
What is WebSocket API?
WebSocket API allows web apps to establish a persistent, bi-directional communicatio‚Ä¶
articles.title: Native support for Socket.IO on Azure, scalability issue no more

articles.author: aarthimurugan
articles.description:
Customers in their migration/modernization journey to cloud want to update their apps to be compatible with the cloud and rebuild the apps as microservices that involve tasks that run for a short time and deployed into a secure container infrastructure and ready for production. For these scenarios, Azure Container Apps Landing Zone Accelerator can help the users start with the best practices included to speed up their production process.
¬†
Azure Container Apps (ACA) Landing Zone Accelerator provides packaged design guidance on critical design areas with reference architecture backed by reference implementation to help users build and deploy containerized apps to Azure Container Apps in an enterprise landing zone design. Landing Zone Accelerator has been built on the lessons we learned with‚Ä¶
articles.title: Azure Container Apps Jobs in a secure Landing Zone

articles.author: AntonioTerra
articles.description:
Welcome to our comprehensive guide dedicated to resolving challenges that arise when Azure App Services encounter difficulties pulling images from the Azure Container Registry (ACR). Deploying applications seamlessly often hinges on a smooth image retrieval process, and encountering obstacles during this phase can disrupt the entire deployment workflow. 
¬†
In this guide, we'll delve into a step-by-step checklist meticulously designed to diagnose and troubleshoot these issues effectively. From initial authentication, those include Admin Credentials, Managed Identity and access permissions to navigating complex network configurations for both Public and Private ingress on the ACR, this resource aims to be your go-to reference for untangling and resolving image pull issues within the Azure ec‚Ä¶
articles.title: Troubleshooting Guide: Resolving Azure App Services Image Pull Issues from Azure Container Registry

articles.author: Sean_Li
articles.description:
Welcome to the first episode of the Java on Azure Container Apps blog series! In case you missed the introductory episode, you can read it here to get a sense of what it‚Äôs about and what you can expect to see in the future.
This blog is based on the Spring Petclinic project with a REST backend and an Angular frontend. The objective is to build and deploy Petclinic on Azure Container Apps and we‚Äôll carry it out in 2 steps:

Build and deploy a Spring REST app to Azure Container Apps directly from the source. 
Package the front-end Angular app in a container first and deploy it to Azure Container Apps.

Build and deploy a Spring app to Azure Container Apps
As a developer, you always want to prioritize retaining the inner loop workflow and developer experience during the coding and testing pha‚Ä¶
articles.title: Java on Azure Container Apps - Build and deploy polyglot apps in two simple steps

articles.author: Calvin_Cai
articles.description:
In this article
¬† ¬†¬†Linux¬†
¬† ¬† ¬† ¬†¬†nslookup¬†
¬† ¬† ¬† ¬†¬†dig¬†

For application running on Azure App Service, sometimes the code throwing error to connect to target service due to intermittent connectivity issue.To identify the issue, it's not convenient if we keep modify and deploy the code, we could use App Service Kudu site to do some quick testing and no need to change any code.
Linux
Login to your app service Kudu site, e.g. https://<appname>.scm.azurewebsites.net, and navigate to "SSH" menu. You should be able to see SSH shell.If you are using custom image, then you need enable it by follow document:¬†https://learn.micr‚Ä¶
articles.title: Troubleshoot intermittent connectivity issue in azure app service

articles.author: kevinguo
articles.description:
Further facilitate teamwork in collaboration apps with Large Language Models
Apps like Microsoft Loop, Figma, Notion, Miro, Framer are redefining remote collaboration. 
Beyond hosting the newest and latest version of a file, these modern collaboration apps allow users to make edits to the same file at the same time as if they were physically next to each other.

With the rise of large language models (LLMs) and their increasingly sophisticated capabilities, we‚Äôd like to explore how AI can further facilitate teamwork using the aforementioned collaboration applications. ¬†
¬†
AI agent as another human collaborator
The mainstream way of interacting with a language model is through a familiar chat interface. One characteristic about this interaction that‚Äôs relevant to our discussion is that it‚Äôs‚Ä¶
articles.title: Supercharge collaboration apps with Large Language Models and Azure SignalR Service

articles.author: thomasgauvinmsft
articles.description:
Welcome to this month‚Äôs newsletter.
We round up the latest news, product announcements, content and community highlights ‚Äì in one compact post.¬†¬†

View the newsletter archives:¬†https://aka.ms/swa/thismonth¬†¬†
Catch the community livestream:¬†https://aka.ms/swa/community/standups

Azure Static Web Apps Livestream¬†
The Community Standups livestream happens on the last Thursday of each month. Join us for the next one¬†for some¬†interactive demo and discussions. 
¬†
This was our last livestream of 2023, but join us again in January as we kickoff the new year with some announcements. This month we walk through using Static Web Apps to build OpenAI chat applications with retrieval augmented generated responses.¬†Check out¬†past episodes¬†for more exciting demos and guests!¬†
¬†
Community Highlights¬†
Recent Azure Static Web Apps announcements:

Build serverless full-stack .NET 8 applications with Blazor WebAssembly and Azure Static Web Apps

Community highlights:

Combining the powers of Azure SWA and APIs - Poornima Nayar - Copenhagen DevFest 2023 - YouTube (Video)
Azure Static Web Apps„Çí‰Ωø„Å£„Å¶Nuxt3„Çµ„Ç§„Éà„Çí„Éá„Éó„É≠„Ç§„Åó„Å¶„Åø„Åü #Node.js ‚Äì Qiita (Blog)

New & updated documentation:

Tutorial: Deploy an Angular app on Azure Static Web Apps | Microsoft Learn

Deploy a Blazor app on Azure Static Web Apps | Microsoft Learn

¬†
Upcoming events

Our first community standup of the new year in January 2024, last Thursday of the month! Follow us on Twitter to get notified.
articles.title: This Month In Azure Static Web Apps | November & December 2023

articles.author: Mayunk Jain
articles.description: Since the announcement of the retirement of App Service Environment v1 and v2, we have been encouraged by the velocity with which organizations have begun upgrading to the latest version. If your organization hasn‚Äôt yet made the switch, consider this blog a gentle nudge to prioritize your migration to App Service Environment v3 before the Aug. 31, 2024, deadline.¬†As a reminder, starting on Jan. 15, 2024, users will no longer be able to create a new App Service Environment v1 or v2. Even though support for existing v1 or v2 environments will continue until the Aug. 31 deadline, App Service Environment created after Jan 15 will be on version 3.¬†To avoid potential disruptions and ensure the seamless operation of your services, we strongly recommend initiating the migration process without del‚Ä¶
articles.title: The countdown is on! Discover resources to upgrade your App Service Environment today

articles.description:
üì¢ Announcements

We have rolled back Kagi Search for Safari extension because of issues reported by users. The URL to download the rolled back version is the same apps.apple.com/us/app/kagi-search-for-safari/id1622835804. We are continuing the development of the 2.0 branch which is open source and you can follow the discussion here.
 


Kagi is popular on Lemmy and a lot of Lemmy users are using Kagi. We have released the first version of a Lemmy/Kbin search lens.  #1659 @Nankeru


Quick answer and Summarize page are quicker and using streaming responses



ü™≤ Bug fixes & Improvements
Improvements to quality of results in user lenses
We are showing less subresults for single domain (it was sometimes overwhelming)
Inline news widget shows more news stories when available
Weather widget should be displayed when searching for "temperature", "humidity" etc #2704 @montag2k 
Cannot highlight search input without risking clearing the entire thing I typed #2779 @guissmo

"enterprise movie" gives back result with Cyrillic spelling #2850 @inesicio 
Info card top is cut off #2811 @Kai

articles.description:
üì¢ Announcements

We have partnered with Brave Search to bring their search results into Kagi. Brave joins the growing list of Kagi's search sources, ensuring that if you can not find something on Kagi, it does not exist on the web. This will come at no additional cost to you, thanks to continuous optimizations in our search stack.



Kagi Assistant usage stats are now on the stats page. Assistant is still in beta and currently available to Ultimate plan users. We plan to roll it out to all members in January.  #2141 @Grooty



We vastly improved Image search results. Check them here including all the powerful filters.





Kagi Search for Safari Extension 2.0 has just launched! We've updated the extension to be cross-platform and rewrote it from scratch for improved reliability, as well a‚Ä¶
articles.title: Dec 28, 2023 - Improved search results and new extension for Safari
